name: Implementation detail pushback: database technology choice

userMessages.content: Use PostgreSQL with JSONB columns for storing article content. We need to be able to query nested fields in the JSON efficiently.

Right, the actual need is that articles have flexible metadata - tags, custom fields that vary by article type, embedded media references. We need to search and filter by any of these fields efficiently. Articles can have 50+ custom fields.

Articles are read-heavy - probably 100:1 read to write ratio. Search needs to return results within 200ms. We have about 500,000 articles currently and expect to grow to 2 million over the next two years.
Makes sense. The key thing is flexible metadata with fast querying at scale.

expectedOpenQuestions: Are there required fields that every article must have, regardless of type?
How frequently do article type schemas change?
Is full-text search across article content required?
expectedNonGoals: Specific database technology selection (PostgreSQL with JSONB is an implementation detail)
